มาถึง "พายุสมบูรณ์แบบ" แล้วหรือ? Liquidations พุ่งสูงขึ้นเมื่อ Bitcoin ร่วงลงต่ำกว่า $70K และ DXY พุ่งสูงขึ้น

Is the “Perfect Storm” Here? Liquidations Explode as Bitcoin Bleeds Below $70K & DXY Rises

1d ago//Yash Jain
bitcoinethereum
AI

Summary

TH

ตลาดคริปโตกำลังเผชิญกับสถานการณ์ “perfect storm” ที่เกิดจากนโยบายที่เข้มงวดของเฟดและการแข็งค่าของดอลลาร์สหรัฐ (DXY) เมื่อ DXY ปรับตัวเพิ่มขึ้น เงินทุนไหลออกจากสินทรัพย์เสี่ยงอย่าง Bitcoin และ Ethereum ไปยังพันธบัตรรัฐบาลที่ปลอดภัยกว่า ทำให้มูลค่าตลาดรวมของคริปโตตกลงเหลือ $2.28 ล้านล้าน ความกังวลด้านภูมิรัฐศาสตร์และความไม่แน่นอนของกฎระเบียบ รวมถึงการไหลกลับของเงินทุนใน Spot ETF ทำให้ตลาดเข้าสู่การแก้ตัวลงอย่างรุนแรงตามหุ้นเทคโนโลยี ความวุ่นวายของตลาดทำให้เกิดการ Liquidation ขนาดใหญ่กว่า $1.43 พันล้านในช่วง 24 ชั่วโมงที่ผ่านมา โดยมีผู้ค้ากว่า 302,000 รายถูก Liquidation ข้อมูลจาก CoinGlass ระบุว่า Bitcoin ($736 ล้าน), Ethereum ($337 ล้าน) และ Solana ($77 ล้าน) ได้รับผลกระทบหนักที่สุด ส่งผลให้มูลค่าความรู้สึกของตลาดเปลี่ยนเป็นลบอย่างชัดเจน

EN

The crypto market is facing a “perfect storm” driven by a hawkish U.S. Federal Reserve and a strengthening U.S. Dollar (DXY). As the DXY rises, capital is rotating from speculative assets like Bitcoin and Ethereum toward safer government bonds, causing the total crypto market cap to drop to $2.28 trillion. This risk-off sentiment is exacerbated by geopolitical tensions, regulatory uncertainty, and a sharp reversal in Spot ETF inflows, creating a deep correction correlated with the struggling tech sector.

Key Points

  • Hawkish Fed policy and rising DXY drive capital from Bitcoin and Ethereum to government bonds.
  • Total crypto market cap dropped to $2.28 trillion, risking a further fall to $1.5 trillion if DXY hits $110.
  • Geopolitical tensions and regulatory fears led to a reversal in Spot ETF inflows.
  • Over $1.43 billion in liquidations occurred in 24 hours, affecting 302,435 traders.
  • Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Solana saw the highest liquidation values and negative sentiment.

Article

Recently, the shift toward a “risk-off” sentiment is largely driven by a more hawkish U.S. Federal Reserve, with the potential for higher-for-longer interest rates strengthening the U.S. Dollar. As a result, the dollar gains strength from $95.56 to $97.80 when writing. Since DXY rose, capital has typically exited speculative assets like Bitcoin and Ethereum and that’s why liquidations has increased in February, as at times like these markets favor safer, yield-bearing government bonds. That’s why TOTAL, which represents the entire crypto market cap, took a deeper hit this time, falling to $2.28 trillion. Whereas TOTAL is at risk if DXY continues to pump around 10%-11%, which could push it to $110 by July 2026, it could harm TOTAL badly, pushing it down 33% to around $1.5 trillion. This event is at higher odds because DXY is supported by the most reliable support, a 200-month EMA, and a decline in the crypto market seems to be intensifying. In February, the decline intensified as global liquidity tightened significantly amid disappointing economic data from major markets, leading to a broader sell-off in the technology sector. Since cryptocurrencies remain highly correlated with tech stocks, the Nasdaq’s February decline triggered a massive wave of liquidations across the crypto market, a trend that could worsen over time. Geopolitical tensions and regulatory uncertainty have further spooked institutional investors, causing a sharp reversal in Spot ETF inflows. This lack of institutional support, combined with a breach of key technical support levels, has created a “perfect storm” that forced the entire sector into a deep correction. The February Fall Intensified With 24-hour Liquidation According to CoinGlass data, over the past 24 hours, 302,435 traders were liquidated, totaling $1.43 billion in liquidations. Across 7 exchanges, data shows over $100 million in liquidations; Bybit saw the most, at $338.54 million, and Hyperliquid was second, at $335.78 million. The latest liquidations data show that top blue-chip coins were hit the hardest. The top 3 cryptocurrencies with the most liquidations were BTC ($736 million), ETH ($337 million), and SOL ($77 million). And the weighted sentiment for this trio has fallen sharply, and most people are talking negatively about these assets.
